McAlester Public Schools would like to say THANK YOU to Sertoma Club of McAlester, Inc. for their donation today of $12,500.00. The donated monies from Sertoma Club along with MPS District funds will be used to purchase UV Filtration Systems for our school sites and facilities including classrooms and other high traffic areas such as cafeterias, band rooms, and weight rooms.

We appreciate the Sertoma Club and their continued support of McAlester Public Schools. Superintendent, Randy Hughes said: "We are constantly looking for ways to help mitigate risks and continue working towards the safety of our faculty, staff, and students especially during this unprecedented time. We are so grateful to the Sertoma Club and their efforts are so appreciated."

Pictured from left to right are: MPS Superintendent Randy Hughes, MPS Board and Sertoma Club member Cameron Fields, Sertoma Club members Jim Kelley, Jennifer Amos Watkins, and RJ Phillips, MPS Assistant Superintendent Don Wise and Assistant Superintendent Chag Gragg
